title: Brendan Rodgers delivers frank assessment of Leicester's wingers: 'We need more from that area of the pitch'
text:
Leicester are third in the Premier League, and have secured more points at this stage than the season they won the title, but there was a stark message here from Brendan Rodgers.

After a fourth home win in a row, Leicester’s manager has warned his wingers that they need to produce far more and ease the pressure on striker Jamie Vardy, who scored his 11th goal in 11 games at the King Power Stadium.

Ayoze Perez, the £30 million summer signing from Newcastle, England under-21 internationals Harvey Barnes and Demarai Gray, plus the vastly experienced Marc Albrighton, have all been told in no uncertain terms by Rodgers that they need to raise their game.

It was Barnes who created the opening Leicester goal for Vardy, while Gray provided the cross for Youri Tielemans’s winner, but Rodgers could not have been more forthright.

“Our wingers need to do more. If we want to be at the top end of this league there needs to be greater efficiency,” he said.
